post.author: Iota
post.body:
It looks like we are getting closer to an actual sentry bot.
http://www.bostondynamics.com/content/sec.php?section=BigDog

post.author: Hostyle
post.body:
lol that video looks so freaky.
But still, terminator type of scenario scares me a little.

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: This actually scares me. I wouldn't like to be alone in the woods with that little monster!

post.author: john_doe2
post.body:
Douglas Quaid wrote:
This actually scares me. I wouldn't like to be alone in the woods with that little monster!


It freaks me out too! It walks so freakin' weird! However, it is definately impressive.

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
Reminds me of a hunter if they can mod it too support only 3 legs.



That is the best real robot I ever seen!

post.author: iceheart
post.body: I want one with a throne on, that would be awesome .

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
iceheart wrote:
I want one with a throne on, that would be awesome .

LoL yeah. Waving to pedestrians while going down to the shops would be cool. I'd walk on the road to slow down cars too haha

post.author: revility
post.body: quadrapeds are what will replace tires, treads, etc. Their just not fast enough... yet. IF you look into the lumbering industry, there are skidders that walk around like this and have been for years. From there its going into general consturtion equipment like bulldozers and loaders. The tech has been slowly advancing for some time. mech walkers and robot version of them aren't too far away from becoming main stream or used in regular military use. Its just a matter of their speed and cost.

post.author: Ivan_the_B
post.body:
Seems like it has sense of humor too!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7_BAJ-d58g

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: That's hilarious.

post.author: Burrito
post.body: Hey Ivan, that vid really made my day...so funny.

post.author: mavrik65
post.body: wow that thing has better balance than me! That's amazing imagine mounting twin shot guns on it and then make it faster, then you've got something to fear. Those organically shaped legs remind me of metal gear solid's geko.

post.author: Darkr0nin
post.body:
ajm113 wrote:
Reminds me of a hunter if they can mod it too support only 3 legs.



That is the best real robot I ever seen!


Heh, that's the first thing that came to my mind.

It is a little weird looking. Kind of loud too. They should probably work on that. It's cool that it can balance itself like that though. Perhaps someday they'll mount a gun on it or something.
